meanings.definition: A track or road on which tramcars or trucks run, especially one laid with rails.
meanings.sent1: The tramroad through the forest was smooth and easy to travel on.
meanings.sent2: The workers loaded the goods onto the tramroad for transport to the city.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the tramroad as a convenient path to gather acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a tramroad of thoughts, each one racing along its own track.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the distant hills, casting a golden glow on the tramroad.

meanings.definition: A railway laid with parallel steel tracks, typically used for transporting goods.
meanings.sent1: The tramroad stretched for miles across the countryside, carrying supplies to the town.
meanings.sent2: The tramroad was busy with trains hauling coal from the mines to the port.
meanings.sent3: The children played near the tramroad, pretending to be conductors on a grand adventure.
meanings.sent4: His life seemed to follow a predetermined tramroad, with little room for deviation.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the train whistle echoed along the tramroad, signaling its approach.
